<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORLD
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/30/everything-happened-q1?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
That's a Wrap on Q1
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="tired" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=358 src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/411/running.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="tired" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/411/running.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ninety days ago we stepped into a new decade arguing over whether it was actually a new decade. Today, we’re in a much different world. On the last day of Q1, let’s take a collective breath and rewind:</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">January </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">President Trump <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/03/oil-prices-rise-iran-vows-retaliation-us?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ordered</a> a strike killing Iran's top commander, Qassem Soleimani. Oil prices and geopolitical tensions soared then fizzled out.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">BlackRock CEO Larry Fink <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/14/investors-tough-passive-aggressive?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> the asset manager is doubling down on confronting climate change, a watershed moment for the environment's role in business decisions.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Trump <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/15/us-china-sign-phase-one-trade-deal-details?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">signed</a> a "phase one" trade deal with China, calming two years of tensions, as well as a North American trade deal. The U.K. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/30/britain-officially-leaves-eu?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">finally Brexited</a>. And China locked down 56 million people as the coronavirus spread. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Kobe Bryant's surprise <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/26/kobe-bryant-19782020?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">death</a> on Jan. 26 united grieving fans from all over the world. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">February</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Iowa caucuses were a technological <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/04/went-wrong-iowa-caucuses?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">disaster</a>. Tesla went on a <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/03/tesla-stock-surges-20?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stock run for the ages</a>. Feb. 7, the Fed said coronavirus could pose a risk to the U.S. economy. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Facebook <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/2020/02/15?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">changed</a> its political ad policies in the wake of Bloomberg memegate. Weinstein was convicted. And Bob Iger abruptly <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/25/bob-iger-hands-disney-ceo-job-head-parks-bob-chapek?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stepped down</a> as Disney CEO. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">By late February, China was slowly getting back to work after many weeks of quarantine, while the U.S. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/27/chinas-ports-business-return-back-life?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">prepared</a> for an outbreak.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">March</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Joe Biden took the lead in the Democratic primary, while competitors like Pete Buttigieg and Elizabeth Warren ended their campaigns.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Saudi Arabia started an <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/08/saudi-arabia-launches-oil-price-war-opec-meeting?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">oil price war</a>, and the U.S. began acutely feeling the coronavirus. Companies started WFH. Sports were canceled. Universities closed. Trump's <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/11/trump-congressional-leaders-negotiate-stimulus-measures?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Oval Office address</a> sent travelers scurrying home from Europe. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In an emergency move to save the economy, the Fed <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/03/fed-cuts-interest-rates-stem-effects-coronavirus?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cut rates</a> half a percentage point. March 9, a stock plunge tripped the circuit breaker. Two days later, the Dow <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/11/dow-enters-bear-market-sp-next?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">entered</a> a bear market. March 16, it logged an almost 3,000 point loss. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">By mid-March, the private sector <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/15/weekend-world-declared-war-coronavirus?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">had mobilized</a> into a wartime economy. Nonessential businesses were closing. 3.3 million Americans filed for <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/26/33m-americans-filed-unemployment-last-week?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unemployment</a> in a <em>week</em>. And the government <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/27/government-deregulation-spree-coronavirus-whacks-economy?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">passed</a> a record $2.2 trillion stimulus package.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>with 2.8+ billion people around the world under some kind of lockdown, many of us will experience Q2 from our living rooms.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/30/macys-furloughs-majority-employees?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Stores Go With the Absolute Minimum
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Macy's is <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-macy-s-layoff/macys-to-furlough-nearly-130000-employees-as-virus-keeps-stores-shut-idUSKBN21H2I7?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">furloughing</a> the majority of its ~130,000 employees because of this startling fact: Almost 800 of its stores have been closed since March 18 and there's no timetable for reopening. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The company will still cover premiums for employees enrolled in health benefits at least through May.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Its digital business will see fewer furloughs, mainly because that's the only business Macy's can run these days.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Defining furlough: </strong>a mandatory leave of absence without pay, often implemented to cut costs in an economic downturn.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Other retailers made <a href="https://www.yahoo.com/lifestyle/gap-furloughs-workers-execs-pay-211059450.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">similar announcements</a> yesterday:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Gap Inc. is furloughing the majority of its store teams in the U.S. and Canada. Its c-suite is also taking a pay cut.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Kohl's is furloughing ~85,000 employees. Its CEO will not take a salary for the duration of the crisis. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Department stores were struggling to grow sales before the coronavirus hit. Now, $430 billion in retail industry revenue could evaporate in the next three months, the National Retail Federation estimates. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Hopeful sign, from China: </strong>As Wuhan opens up for business, customers want to "<a href="https://apnews.com/271f111bb8c6a2227411c7fa490bbf26?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">revenge shop</a>," the AP reports.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F03%2F30%2Fmacys-furloughs-majority-employees" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MANUFACTURING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/30/race-build-ventilators?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Honk If You're Building a Ventilator
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Visualization of lungs as oxygen tanks " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNzcvdmVudGlsYXRvci5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With demand for their *actual* products next to nil, some of the world's most iconic manufacturers are trying to make up for the critical shortage of life-saving ventilators.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Ford and GE Healthcare </strong>said yesterday they're going to pump out 50,000 ventilators in just 100 days. Production at the Ypsilanti, MI, plant will be a <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/03/30/ford-ge-healthcare-to-produce-50000-ventilators-by-july-using-this-tiny-companys-design/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">24/7 operation</a> run by 500 United Auto Workers union members. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">GM's breathless sprint </strong>to build ventilators seems like it'll be optioned into a Hollywood script: The <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/30/business/gm-ventilators-coronavirus-trump.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NYT</a>, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/gm-hustles-to-pump-out-ventilators-to-fight-coronavirus-amid-trump-barbs-11585586925?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WSJ</a>, and <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-30/inside-gm-s-four-week-sprint-to-build-emergency-ventilators?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bloomberg</a> all went behind-the-scenes of this fascinating corporate drama.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Virgin Orbit, </strong>Richard Branson's rocket company, said it will be able to produce a few hundred ventilators per week starting next month, pending regulatory approval.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Ventilator Challenge U.K. </strong>is a group of 14 British manufacturers (including Rolls-Royce) making <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/mar/29/ventilator-challenge-uk-to-start-production-in-covid-19-fight?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">two different ventilator models</a> known as Project Oyster and Project Penguin.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>expect others to join the party. Medtronic,<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>a $123 billion medical device giant, <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/03/30/medtronic-is-sharing-its-portable-ventilator-design-specifications-and-code-for-free-to-all/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">published the specs</a> for one of its ventilators online yesterday to make it easier for non-ventilator makers to produce their own. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY THE MOTLEY FOOL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
One of The Fool’s Smartest Analysts Talked Us Down
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/25/world-asking-good-time-invest" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="The Motley Fool" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMTEzLzE1ODQwMjgwOTAtRmluYW5jZS0zNS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJjb21ldC1tb3JuaW5nYnJldyIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Right now, we’re craving information. Like you, us lowly ad writers open up this here newsletter everyday hungering for the who/what/when/where/why of just whatever the heck is going on.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And when it comes to investing, basically we have <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/25/world-asking-good-time-invest" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">one question</a>: Should we even be doing that right now? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So to help us come up with an answer for such a beguiling question, we sat down with one of <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/25/world-asking-good-time-invest" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Motley Fool’s Investment Analysts</a>, a modest, kind genius named Emily Flippen. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/25/world-asking-good-time-invest" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">our conversation</a>, we left feeling a little less lost, a little more at ease, and quite a bit more comfortable using the world “dividend” in casual conversation. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Take a look at <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/25/world-asking-good-time-invest" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the article we put together</a> with Emily’s help. And to Emily, sorry for the joke we insisted on telling you about the bull and bear who walked into a bar.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/30/local-news-struggles-coronavirus-hits-ad-revenues?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
For Publishers, It’s More Business, Less Money
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Facebook <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/30/business/facebook-media-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> $100 million in grants and marketing for local news organizations. For some publishers, that’s like getting a Kit Kat from the bully who stole your lunch money, but right now the industry is facing bigger problems. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The coronavirus pandemic has sent pageviews and subscriptions soaring, but advertisers are pulling spots because of the uncertainty. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Some alt-weeklies have laid off three-quarters of their staff, the NYT reports. BuzzFeed and American Media cut salaries. Many others reduced hours or furloughed employees. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Gov. Phil Scott recently <a href="https://twitter.com/jcstearns/status/1244446786212765710?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">called on Vermonters</a> to support local news. But is that enough? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The <a href="https://www.niemanlab.org/2020/03/newsonomics-what-was-once-unthinkable-is-quickly-becoming-reality-in-the-destruction-of-local-news/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">loss of ad revenue</a> is greater than incoming subscriptions, and outlets most dependent on advertising (the free ones) are at high-risk, Nieman Lab writes. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The cruel irony: More consumers are willing to pay for local reporting for the first time in years, but the blow to ad revenue may be too crippling.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The NYT's Ben Smith <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/29/business/coronavirus-journalists-newspapers.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">argues</a> we should abandon for-profit newspaper models and move strictly online, effectively "bailing out" the journalists. Others <a href="https://www.vanityfair.com/news/2020/03/can-the-news-industry-survive-coronavirus?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">think</a> the government should support local outlets through initiatives like public health ad campaigns.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The USNS Comfort sailed into New York Harbor yesterday in the <a href="https://www.politico.com/states/new-york/albany/story/2020/03/30/usns-comfort-arrives-in-new-york-city-1269589?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">best grand entrance</a> since Willy Wonka. The Navy's hospital ship, home to 1,000 beds and 1,200 medical staff, will be used to relieve some of the strain on the city's healthcare system. It'll start treating patients today.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">A couple of interesting facts:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The last time this ship was deployed to NYC was following 9/11.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>If propped up vertically, it'd be the </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/RyanfDuffy/status/1244635430663917568?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">13th tallest building</a></span><span> in the city. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

PODCAST
</h3>

The Business of Giving Back
</font></a>
</h1>

<img alt="Scott Harrison / Business Casual" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MDYvc2NvdHRfaGFycmlzb25fYnVzaW5lc3NfY2FzdWFsLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">You could use some good news.</strong> Today on Morning Brew’s <em>Business Casual </em>podcast, we’re delivering just that—a conversation on the business of giving back with charity: water founder Scott Harrison. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Harrison explains why the cult favorite nonprofit he runs is more concerned with projects from Nike or Apple than the ASPCA. Plus, he justifies his unique, tech-influenced (and sometimes controversial) nonprofit business model. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Listen here:</strong> <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/scottharrison_apple?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apple</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/scottharrison_spotify?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spotify</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/scottharrison_all?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">everywhere else</a></p>
</td>

BREW'S BETS
</h3>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CALENDAR
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/30/morning-brews-daily-quarantine-planner-march-31?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Your Daily Quarantine Planner: March 31
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Skateboarder in California" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MTIvc2thdGVib2FyZGVyX2luX2NhbGlmb3JuaWEuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Mario Tama/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s Jamie, the Brew’s editorial coordinator and unofficial SoCal correspondent. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><strong style="color:#000"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/athletic-shoe_1f45f.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> Morning workout</strong></h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Try Peloton’s <a href="https://www.onepeloton.com/app?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">15-minute workouts</a>. They don’t require expensive equipment, and right now the app is free for 90 days.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><strong style="color:#000"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/headphone_1f3a7.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> Work soundtrack </strong></h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Some artists that make me feel like I’m back in a Brooklyn coffee shop: </span><span><a href="https://open.spotify.com/artist/6yby1ACnfwVigbSSaH3kEQ?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">City Girl</a></span><span>, </span><span><a href="https://open.spotify.com/artist/2mVVjNmdjXZZDvhgQWiakk?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Khruangbin</a></span><span>, </span><span><a href="https://open.spotify.com/artist/43JlwunhXm1oqdKyOa2Z9Y?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Hiatus Kaiyote</a></span><span>, and </span><span><a href="https://open.spotify.com/artist/1EpyA68dKpjf7jXmQL88Hy?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Noname</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>And back by </span><span><span style="text-decoration: line-through;">popular</span></span><span> one reader's demand, more video game music: </span><span><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ACxbAjr6ecE&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Playstation and Lofi</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><strong style="color:#000">🍽 Lunch, but make it productive</strong></h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Level up: </strong>Morning Brew CEO Alex Lieberman chatted with Retail Brew writer Halie LeSavage about COVID-19's impact on the industry. <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/posts/alex-lieberman_i-chat-live-with-retail-brew-writer-halie-ugcPost-6649051401706094592-FPlZ?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Watch it here</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Do good: </strong>Put this <a href="https://www.instagram.com/p/B-NP3d9hZsS/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">online music festival</a> on your calendar for this weekend. The proceeds go to out-of-work artists.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stay up-to-date: </strong>Two Dr. Fauci interviews with the right mix of realism and optimism: <a href="https://www.sciencemag.org/news/2020/03/i-m-going-keep-pushing-anthony-fauci-tries-make-white-house-listen-facts-pandemic?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Science</a> and <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8A3jiM2FNR8&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Trevor Noah</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/canned-food_1f96b.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> Dinner plans </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Since I’m in SoCal, I’ll be binging on Mexican takeout for the foreseeable future. You can always eat local and be lazy at the same time with free Uber Eats delivery.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><strong style="color:#000"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/television_1f4fa.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> Evening activity</strong></h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">No screen, kinda: </strong>1) Learn to paint with artists going live on Instagram, like my fellow USC alum <a href="https://www.instagram.com/juuubug/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Julia Ryan</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Screen:</strong> Both of my favorite Ari Aster flicks are on Amazon Prime Video: <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Midsommar-Florence-Pugh/dp/B07T8K9YSH?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Midsommar</a> and <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Hereditary-Toni-Collette/dp/B07DJ1BXPM/ref=sr_1_1?crid=243L5S3LLE26I&dchild=1&keywords=hereditary&qid=1585595089&s=instant-video&sprefix=hered%2Cinstant-video%2C213&sr=1-1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Hereditary</a>. </p>
<hr>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/house-with-garden_1f3e1.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""><strong data-stringify-type="bold" style="color:#000">We want you to live your best quarantined life</strong>—so much so, that we launched a brand new, free newsletter to be your guide. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/the-essentials/?utm_medium=onsite&utm_campaign=dailyplanner_032020&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check out The Essentials→</a></em></p>

<img alt="Parish Garden in Nuenen, Spring" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MDcvcGFyaXNoX2dhcmRlbl9pbl9udWVuZW5fc3ByaW5nLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">

</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At 3:15am local time Monday morning, thieves broke into a Dutch museum that's been closed due to the coronavirus and <a href="https://www.dutchnews.nl/news/2020/03/van-gogh-painting-stolen-from-museum-during-coronavirus-shutdown/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stole</a> the painting “The Parsonage Garden at Nuenen in Spring.” Do you know which artist painted it?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">A few hints: </strong><span>He lived from 1853–1890. </span><span>Other famous works include "Wheatfield with Cypresses," "The Potato Eaters," and "Sunflowers." </span>He was not quite whole. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Scroll down for the answer.</em></p>

On the last day of Q1, let’s take a collective breath and rewind:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eJanuary \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePresident Trump \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/03/oil-prices-rise-iran-vows-retaliation-us?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eordered\u003c/a\u003e a strike killing Iran's top commander, Qassem Soleimani. Oil prices and geopolitical tensions soared then fizzled out.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBlackRock CEO Larry Fink \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/14/investors-tough-passive-aggressive?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e the asset manager is doubling down on confronting climate change, a watershed moment for the environment's role in business decisions.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTrump \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/15/us-china-sign-phase-one-trade-deal-details?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esigned\u003c/a\u003e a \"phase one\" trade deal with China, calming two years of tensions, as well as a North American trade deal. The U.K. \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/30/britain-officially-leaves-eu?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efinally Brexited\u003c/a\u003e. And China locked down 56 million people as the coronavirus spread. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eKobe Bryant's surprise \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/26/kobe-bryant-19782020?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edeath\u003c/a\u003e on Jan. 26 united grieving fans from all over the world. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eFebruary\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Iowa caucuses were a technological \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/04/went-wrong-iowa-caucuses?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edisaster\u003c/a\u003e. Tesla went on a \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/03/tesla-stock-surges-20?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estock run for the ages\u003c/a\u003e. Feb. 7, the Fed said coronavirus could pose a risk to the U.S. economy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFacebook \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/2020/02/15?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003echanged\u003c/a\u003e its political ad policies in the wake of Bloomberg memegate. Weinstein was convicted. And Bob Iger abruptly \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/25/bob-iger-hands-disney-ceo-job-head-parks-bob-chapek?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estepped down\u003c/a\u003e as Disney CEO. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBy late February, China was slowly getting back to work after many weeks of quarantine, while the U.S. \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/27/chinas-ports-business-return-back-life?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprepared\u003c/a\u003e for an outbreak.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eMarch\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJoe Biden took the lead in the Democratic primary, while competitors like Pete Buttigieg and Elizabeth Warren ended their campaigns.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSaudi Arabia started an \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/08/saudi-arabia-launches-oil-price-war-opec-meeting?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoil price war\u003c/a\u003e, and the U.S. began acutely feeling the coronavirus. Companies started WFH. Sports were canceled. Universities closed. Trump's \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/11/trump-congressional-leaders-negotiate-stimulus-measures?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eOval Office address\u003c/a\u003e sent travelers scurrying home from Europe. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn an emergency move to save the economy, the Fed \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/03/fed-cuts-interest-rates-stem-effects-coronavirus?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecut rates\u003c/a\u003e half a percentage point. March 9, a stock plunge tripped the circuit breaker. Two days later, the Dow \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/11/dow-enters-bear-market-sp-next?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eentered\u003c/a\u003e a bear market. March 16, it logged an almost 3,000 point loss. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBy mid-March, the private sector \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/15/weekend-world-declared-war-coronavirus?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehad mobilized\u003c/a\u003e into a wartime economy. Nonessential businesses were closing. 3.3 million Americans filed for \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/26/33m-americans-filed-unemployment-last-week?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunemployment\u003c/a\u003e in a \u003cem\u003eweek\u003c/em\u003e. And the government \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/27/government-deregulation-spree-coronavirus-whacks-economy?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epassed\u003c/a\u003e a record $2.2 trillion stimulus package.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ewith 2.8+ billion people around the world under some kind of style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etwo different ventilator models\u003c/a\u003e known as Project Oyster and Project Penguin.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRight now, we’re craving information. Like you, us lowly ad writers open up this here newsletter everyday hungering for the who/what/when/where/why of just whatever the heck is going on.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd when it comes to investing, basically we have \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/25/world-asking-good-time-invest\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eone question\u003c/a\u003e: Should we even be doing that right now? \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo to help us come up with an answer for such a beguiling question, we sat down with one of \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/25/world-asking-good-time-invest\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eThe Motley Fool’s Investment Analysts\u003c/a\u003e, a modest, kind genius named Emily Flippen. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/25/world-asking-good-time-invest\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eour conversation\u003c/a\u003e, we left feeling a little less lost, a little more at ease, and quite a bit more comfortable using the world “dividend” in casual conversation. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTake a look at \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/25/world-asking-good-time-invest\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe article we put together\u003c/a\u003e with Emily’s help. style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nFor Publishers, It’s More Business, Less Money\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Facebook \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/30/business/facebook-media-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e $100 million in grants and marketing for local news organizations. For some publishers, that’s like getting a Kit Kat from the bully who stole your lunch money, but right now the industry is facing bigger problems. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe coronavirus pandemic has sent pageviews and subscriptions soaring, but advertisers are pulling spots because of the uncertainty. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSome alt-weeklies have laid off three-quarters of their staff, the NYT reports. BuzzFeed and American Media cut salaries. Many others reduced hours or furloughed employees. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGov. Phil Scott recently \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/jcstearns/status/1244446786212765710?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecalled on Vermonters\u003c/a\u003e to support local news. But is that enough? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe \u003ca href=\"https://www.niemanlab.org/2020/03/newsonomics-what-was-once-unthinkable-is-quickly-becoming-reality-in-the-destruction-of-local-news/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eloss of ad revenue\u003c/a\u003e is greater than incoming subscriptions, and outlets most dependent on advertising (the free ones) are at high-risk, Nieman Lab writes. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe cruel irony: More consumers are willing to pay for local reporting for the first time in years, but the blow to ad revenue may be too crippling.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe NYT's Ben Smith \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/29/business/coronavirus-journalists-newspapers.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eargues\u003c/a\u003e we should abandon for-profit newspaper models and move strictly online, effectively \"bailing out\" the journalists.
